p: In summary, as a heat-sensitive plant, the ability of S. calendulacea to resist HT stress in South China was far lower than that of S. trilobata. The main reason was the difference of photosynthesis in response to HT stress ( Figure 6). The resistance of S. trilobata to cope with HT stress was better than that of S. calendulacea, which made it a single superior population in the invasion area. These results further indicated that the gradual warming of global temperature will greatly accelerate the invasion area of S. trilobata.
